thread.title: Naomi Campbell, Jourdan Dunn, Suki Waterhouse, and Burberry’s Front Row Models
thread.title_full: Naomi Campbell, Jourdan Dunn, Suki Waterhouse, and Burberry’s Front Row Models

title: Naomi Campbell, Jourdan Dunn, Suki Waterhouse, and Burberry’s Front Row Models
text: Naomi, Adwoa, Suki, and More: Burberry Brings Its Favorite Faces to the Front Row February 21, 2017 1:08 AM 1 / 10 From left: Adwoa Aboah, Lily Donaldson, and Jean Campbell Photo: Getty Images Burberry’s lineup of models doesn’t end with the faces who walk its collections. Campaign stars and former runway regulars return to watch the show each season and, for Spring 2017, the front row was a who’s who of Burberry beauties past and present. Leading the pack was supermodel Naomi Campbell, who sported a ruffled overcoat and glossy red lip as she sat next to Penélope Cruz and fellow Christopher Bailey muse, Suki Waterhouse, today at Makers House. Wearing a punky crop top and sheer skirt, Waterhouse was miles away from her bohemian image. The parade of superstars continued, with each one putting her spin on the label’s look: Erin O’Connor was graceful in a crisp white blouse, Jourdan Dunn daring in a lengthy denim cape, and Lily Donaldson sexy in a transparent minidress. Even the newer members of the clique got in on the action, with Adwoa Aboah donning an updated take on the classic trench and Jean Campbell in a flirty jumper and sky-high heels. With the versatility of Christopher Bailey’s designs on display, Burberry’s model squad added another layer of interest to a fashion event simply by looking phenomenal in the clothes. In This Story: Burberry
